CoreData.name: defaults to json file name
flower: can be a single tag or a list of blocks/fluid ex. minecraft:coal_block
CoreData.entityFlower: alternatively the flower can be a single entity

HoneycombData.honeycombType: can be one of three options: NONE, DEFAULT, CUSTOM
HoneycombData.color: either a color name or a hex color, can also be named rainbow
HoneycombData.item: the id for the bees honeycomb, this is required even if it uses a default honeycomb
HoneycombData.block: the id for the bees honeycomb block, this is required even if it uses a default honeycomb

layers.color: either a color name or a hex color, can also be named rainbow
layers.texture: path to texture, can have multiple layers up to 6

ColorData.spawnEggPrimaryColor: either a color name or a hex color, can also be named rainbow
ColorData.spawnEggSecondaryColor: either a color name or a hex color, can also be named rainbow
ColorData.jarColor: either a color name or a hex color, can also be named rainbow

RenderData.modelType: options available: DEFAULT, ORE, GELATINOUS, DRAGON, QUEEN, VILLAGER, MUSHROOM, CROP, ARMORED, GUARDIAN

mutations.type: options are NONE, ITEM, BLOCK, ENTITY
input: can be a single tag or a list of blocks/fluids ex. minecraft:coal_block
mutations.entityInput: alternatively the flower can be a single entity
mutations.tag: put nbt data for the input here

outputs.output: put the namespace:id for whatever the output is here - can have multiple outputs as specified by the {}
outputs.tag: put nbt data for the output here

item.id: put the namespace:id for whatever the output is here - can have up to 3 item outputs as specified by the {}
item.tag: put nbt data for the output here

item.id: put the namespace:id for whatever the output is here - can have up to 3 fluid outputs as specified by the {}
item.tag: put nbt data for the output here

biomeWhitelist: or biome type tags as specified by the tag prefix:  tag:overworld
biomeBlacklist: or biome type tags as specified by the tag prefix:  tag:overworld

parent1: up with the parents in parent2
parent2: up with the parents in parent1
feedItem: can be a single tag'' or a list[] of blocks/fluids ex. minecraft:coal_block
BreedData.feedReturnItem: the ID of the item returned to the player. this is good for stuff like fluid buckets

traits: a list of traits to apply to the bee. options available are:
wither, blaze, can_swim, creeper, zombie, pigman, ender, nether, slimy, desert, flammable, teleport, setOnFire, explosive, angry, spider
you can also custom define trait data to a specific bee as seen below

potionDamageEffects.effect: namespace:ID of the Mob Effect - can be a list of effects as indicated by the {}

potionImmunities: namespace:ID of the Mob Effect - can be a list of effect ID's

damageTypes.damageType: can be either 'setOnFire' or 'explosive' - can be list but really there's only two choices soo

specialAbilities: a list of special abilities custom coded in the mod. options are: teleport, flammable, slimy, setOnFire, spider
particles: a list of ID's for any particle registered in the game including modded.
